meanings.definition: Isomerases: enzymes that catalyze the rearrangement of atoms within a molecule to form isomers
meanings.sent1: The isomerases in our body help change molecules into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study isomerases to understand how atoms can be rearranged in a molecule.
meanings.sent3: The isomerases at the molecular party were busy rearranging their dance partners.
meanings.sent4: The isomerases acted like molecular architects, reshaping the structure of the compound.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the isomerases worked tirelessly to create new isomers.

meanings.definition: Isomerases: proteins that facilitate the conversion of one isomer into another
meanings.sent1: Proteins known as isomerases help transform one isomer into a different form.
meanings.sent2: The isomerases in the cell play a crucial role in changing isomers.
meanings.sent3: At the protein party, the isomerases were the experts in transforming shapes.
meanings.sent4: The isomerases were like shape-shifters, turning one isomer into another effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: In the biochemical reaction, the isomerases smoothly converted one form to another.

meanings.definition: Isomerases: biological catalysts that promote the interconversion of isomers
meanings.sent1: Biological catalysts called isomerases encourage the transformation between isomers.
meanings.sent2: Researchers study how isomerases facilitate the conversion of isomers.
meanings.sent3: The isomerases in the cell were like matchmakers, pairing up different isomers.
meanings.sent4: In the biochemical dance, the isomerases led the isomers through their transformation steps.
meanings.sent5: The isomerases worked like magic, seamlessly converting one isomer to another.
